PerfectNetExp.abs: 普通英汉小词典_翻译家(Fanyijia.com) ... comparative 比较的 comparatively 比较地 compare 比较.
数学英语词汇表[翻译必看] ... Variational method 变分方法 comparatively adv. 比较地, 相当地 deficiency n. 缺乏, 不足.
He was comparatively calm and concentrated in judging how to defeat his opponent ., 他相对冷静沉着 , 聚精会神地判断如何打败对手.
We are comparatively certain about our own situation.  我们对己方的情况较为确定。  更多详细释义帮小D改进本词参考例句同反义词.

entry.def: You use comparative to show that you are judging something against a previous or different situation. For example, comparative calm is a situation which is calmer than before or calmer than the situation in other places.

example.ex: ...those who manage to reach the comparative safety of Fendel...
example.tran: 达到“芬司匹利”药品相对安全标准的那些药

example.ex: The task was accomplished with comparative ease.
example.tran: 相对而言，任务完成得比较轻松。

entry.def: A comparative study is a study that involves the comparison of two or more things of the same kind.

example.ex: ...a comparative study of the dietary practices of people from various regions of India.
example.tran: 对印度各地区的人饮食习惯的比较研究

example.ex: ...a professor of English and comparative  literature.
example.tran: 研究英语和比较文学的教授

entry.def: In grammar, the comparative form of an adjective or adverb shows that something has more of a quality than something else has. For example, 'bigger' is the comparative form of 'big', and 'more quickly' is the comparative form of 'quickly'.

means.word_mean: 1. in a relative manner; by comparison to something else;

auth_sentence.content: It makes Rachmaninov's Second Symphony seem comparatively modest.
auth_sentence.res_content: It makes Rachmaninov's Second Symphony seem comparatively modest.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: It makes Rachmaninov's Second Symphony seem comparatively modest.

auth_sentence.content: Comparatively, Corvette ZR-1s are as common as houseflies.
auth_sentence.res_content: Comparatively, Corvette ZR-1s are as common as houseflies.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Comparatively, Corvette ZR-1s are as common as houseflies.

auth_sentence.content: Dangerous human proclivities can be canalised into comparatively harmless channels.
auth_sentence.res_content: Dangerous human proclivities can be canalised into comparatively harmless channels.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Dangerous human proclivities can be canalised into comparatively harmless channels.

stems_affixes.type_exp: 1. =bring birth,表示"生产,生出小孩"; 2. =come in sight,表示"看见;出现"; 3. =get ready,表示"准备;安置"; 4. =equal,表示"平等"

stems_affixes.value_cn: 一胎多子的, 经产的, 非初产的, [植]多产的
stems_affixes.word_buile: multi多+par生产,生出小孩+ous……的→多生产的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 初产的, 初次分娩的
stems_affixes.word_buile: primi=prim第一,最初+par生产,生出小孩+ous……的→adj.初产的, 初次分娩的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 每次产一个卵的; 每胎生一子的
stems_affixes.word_buile: uni单一+par生产,生出小孩+ous……的→生出一个

stems_affixes.value_cn: 表面上的,貌似真实的;显然的,明明白白的

trans横穿+par看见;出现+ent……的→横穿过去看得一样清楚→透明的
in不+separable[adj.可分离的, 可分的]→adj.不能分的
se分离+par置+able……的→adj.可分离的, 可分的
se分离+par置+ate表形容词→adj.分开的, 分离的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 无准备的, 即席的, 尚未准备好的
stems_affixes.word_buile: un无+prepare准备+ed……的→adj.无准备的, 即席的, 尚未准备好的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 可比较的, 比得上的
stems_affixes.word_buile: compare比较+able……的→adj.可比较的, 比得上的
compare比较+ative表形容词→adj.比较的, 相当的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 奇数的,不成对的,不平等
stems_affixes.word_buile: im不+parity[n.同等;奇偶]→adj.奇数的,不成对的,不平等
non不,无+par平等+eil→无平等的→无与伦比的
apparent显然的+ly表副词→adv.显然地
separate分开+ly表副词→adv.个别地;分离地
comparative[adj.比较的, 相当的]+ly表副词→adv.比较地, 相当地
par生产,生出小孩+ent……人→n.父母,母亲;[n.]双亲;父母

stems_affixes.value_cn: 透明, 透明度, 幻灯片, 有图案的玻璃
stems_affixes.word_buile: transparent[[adj.透明的]]→n.透明, 透明度, 幻灯片, 有图案的玻璃

stems_affixes.value_cn: 器械,器具,仪器;机构,组织
stems_affixes.word_buile: ap=ad+par准备;安置+atus表名词→准备好用的东西→设备
par准备;安置+ade表名词→本为部队训练场[即准备打仗得地方],引申为排队游行
prepare准备+ation行为,过程→n.准备, 预备
re再+pair=par准备;安置→重新准备好→修理
com一起+pari=par平等+son→一起平等→比较
dis不+parity同等→n.不同,差异
par平等→n.一对, 一双
par平等+ity表名词→n.同等;奇偶
par准备;安置+ade表名词→本为部队训练场[即准备打仗得地方],引申为排队游行
par准备;安置+ade表名词→本为部队训练场[即准备打仗得地方],引申为排队游行
pre预先+par准备;安置+e→预先准备好
re再+pair=par准备;安置→重新准备好→修理
com共同+par平等+e→平等的放在一起→比较
dis不+par平等+age动词后缀→不平等对待→轻视

sentences.en: He was comparatively calm and concentrated in judging how to defeat his opponent.
sentences.cn: 他相对冷静沉着,聚精会神地判断如何打败对手。

sentences.en: The minister appealed to the Cabinet not to target her comparatively tiny budget of ￡4 billion.
sentences.cn: 那位部长呼吁内阁不要以她40 亿英镑这样相对小额的预算为批评目标。
在贸易事务上比较自由主义的

sentences.en: She was then still comparatively unknown.
sentences.cn: 她那时候还不怎么出名。

sentences.en: The situation was still comparatively calm there,he reported.
sentences.cn: 他报告说:那里的局势还比较平静。
